result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse James Hertlein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civi judgment.  All court costs, surcharges and assessments.
*Restitutoin set at zero.
Referral to the Mental Health Division of the probation department, and treatment if  deemed appropriate. Take any and all prescribed medications as prescribed and as directed by a doctor.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealing.
No violent contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint, to be removed at the discretion of the agent.

Cooperate with agent.
Anger management courses.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

records.addlTxt: Counts two and three.
Count one.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.   PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Michelle D., and Patricia K.

Count 1 as amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. No goodtime.  Court will allow for release to the Day Reporting Center for treatment and programming. 

Count 2 as amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 84 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  Straight time.

Count 3 as amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Corrections  CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentences on Counts 2 and 3 as amended and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding
-Cooperate with agent
-Absolute sobriety
-Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests
-No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing
- AODA assessment and treatment
-Referral to the Mental Health Division of the Probation Department, and treatment if deemed appropriate, and take any and all prescribed medications as prescribed and as directed by a doctor
-Anger Management  courses
-No violent contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint; to be removed at the discretion of the agent


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, surcharges, and assessments

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

As to Counts 1, 2, and 3 as amended: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Jesse James Hertlein in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Jesse James Hertlein in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Negotiations placed on the record. Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Court ordered Count 2 amended to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Court ordered Count 3 amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1) and 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.
Defense motion for modification of bail heard and denied.
Court modifies the no contact order to a no violent contact order.

Defendant Jesse James Hertlein in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Jesse James Hertlein in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant undecided as to taking State's offer.  State's offer only open until next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Jesse James Hertlein not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another date for the projected guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
